discover: Discover all my work in computer science development

about.title: Who is Noam Joly-Girods?
paragraphs: Noam is still a young computer science student, capable of great things thanks to his extraordinary adaptability and very complete team spirit.
He knows when to work and when to have fun.
He has a good level in computer development and sincerely wishes to create the most beautiful and functional applications.
All these points make him so remarkable haha...

projects.title: IT Request Management
projects.description: Web application for IT request management used for budget planning of the city of Montbéliard. Developed during my second-year internship.

projects.title: Balonu
projects.description: Website to sell hot-air balloon rides during an event, using multiple user roles like provider and admin.

projects.title: Quoridor
projects.description: Board game Quoridor in graphical and console versions, built from a library provided without documentation.

projects.title: USB Key Sales Website
projects.description: Website to sell USB keys during an event, using multiple user roles like provider and admin.

projects.title: About Dailymotion
projects.description: Website to learn about the history of Dailymotion.

projects.title: Letterboxd
projects.description: Website working like a simplified version of Letterboxd. Users can view a list of movies, mark them as watched, and add reviews.

projects.title: PopGuess
projects.description: Android application to play PopGuess, a game where you guess pop culture characters from scrambled letters of their names.

projects.title: Chat application
projects.description: Application allowing real-time chatting with people. Users can register, log in, and communicate.

about_intro.p1: <0>Student in third year of BUT computer science</0>, I invest in the development of <1>web applications</1> and <2>mobile applications</2> with the desire to create concrete and useful solutions.
about_intro.p2: My journey has led me to explore different aspects of <0>development</0>, from <1>programming</1> to <2>database management</2>, passing by <3>team work</3> on collaborative projects. These experiences have allowed me to develop an <4>organization sense</4>, <5>rigor</5> and a <6>ability to adapt</6> to the challenges encountered. I particularly enjoy learning new technologies and implementing them to solve real problems. Whether in autonomy or within a team, I always strive to evolve while contributing usefully. My goal is to continue to progress in a field where each project can have a real impact.

portfolio.texte: Here are my various supervised projects and internships that I carried out during my years of BUT computer science at the IUT Nord Franche-Comté
portfolio.sae: SAE 3rd year of BUT computer science

saes6.title: Yoleau — river analysis application
saes6.description: The app's primary purpose is to analyze river water to provide accurate information on its quality, particularly for outdoor swimming enthusiasts. It is equipped with sensors that measure pH, turbidity, temperature, and water conductivity. In addition to these measurements, an analysis of videos taken by users allows for the calculation of current flow. Using artificial intelligence, the app is able to predict the evolution of certain variables over a seven-day period, thus providing the user with better anticipation of water conditions.

stage.title: ASPORTA — Dynamic website
stage.description: Development of a first dynamic website for the ASPORTA association connected to a database, with users having different roles and site management functionalities via a dashboard.
